item.title: What to know about Kevin Warsh, President Trump's proposed Fed chair
item.description: President Trump announced he plans to nominate Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve. Gene Sperling, former director of the National Economic Council, weighs in.
item.content:encoded: President Trump announced he plans to nominate Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve. Gene Sperling, former director of the National Economic Council, weighs in.

item.title: Trump taps Kevin Warsh to lead the Federal Reserve
item.description: Trump plans to nominate Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve, when Jerome Powell's term expires in May. The president has been pushing the central bank to slash interest rates.

item.title: We've been hearing about the EU's economic 'bazooka.' Here's what it is
item.description: As tensions simmer between the European Union and the U.S. over the Trump administration's trade policies and its play for Greenland, we've been hearing about the EU's economic "bazooka." What is it?

item.title: Federal Reserve votes to hold rates steady despite pressure from Trump
item.description: President Trump has been pressing the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates more aggressively, but the central bank voted to hold rates steady for now, as it tries to bring down inflation.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has been pressing the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates more aggressively, but the central bank voted to hold rates steady for now, as it tries to bring down inflation.

item.title: Fed holds interest rates steady, taking a pause from rate cuts to assess the economy
item.description: The central bank cut rates at its three previous meetings in an effort to support the job market. But with inflation still elevated, the Fed is cautious about additional rate cuts.

item.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.

item.title: A crackdown on immigration is leading to a sharp drop in U.S. population growth
item.description: A sharp drop in net immigration has led to a slowdown in U.S. population growth. The Census Bureau says the population grew only about half as fast in the year ending last June as it did the previous year.

item.title: How Americans feel about the economy and their spending habits
item.description: Americans are still spending money, which is helping drive solid economic growth, but a large share of that spending is being done by a relatively small group of well-off shoppers.
